sections.content:
Question:
How do I understand the part number of the RA4L1
Answer:
The RA4L1 Part numbering system allows us to indicate the operating temperate, package type and memory size of a specific device. Each P/N begins R7FA4L1B. The B represents that this device contains CAN FD.
The next digit prepresents the memory size and can be B for 256k flash and D for 512k flash.
The next digit is temperature range, and can be a 3 - 105 degree C operation or a 4 for 125 degree C operation, this is dependant on package.
Finally we have the package code.
FP       LQFP100
FM       LQFP64
FL        LQFP48
NE       QFN48
AG       BGA100
AH       BGA64
DB       CSP72
You can find a full explanation of the part number in the RA4L1 Hardware Manual.
Suitable Products
RA4L1
